title: GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR SERVICES OF NEPAL TELECOM
introduction: These General Terms and Conditions (GTC) define the binding rights and obligations of Nepal Doorsanchar Company Limited, (hereinafter Nepal Telecom) and its Subscribers on the delivery and use of the Services as defined herein. The primary mode of communication of this GTC is through publication on the Nepal Telecom official website and APP.

text: These Terms and Conditions shall commence and be in force and effective from the date of commencement of the Service to the Subscriber until terminated by either party in accordance with the GTC. However, Termination of Service shall not absolve the Subscriber from his obligations to pay any outstanding payment to Nepal Telecom.
The billing/units shall be calculated as follows:
Calls: units based on minutes rounded up to the next minute or units based on per-second, or specific pulse rate as the case maybe.
SMS/MMS: number of messages
Data: per packet basis (rounded up to the next Kilobyte, 10 Kilobytes, Megabyte)
Other services: as prescribed by Nepal Telecom from time to time.

A Credit Limit for the Service Dues will be given to the subscribers only at the discretion of Nepal Telecom and on such terms and conditions decided by Nepal Telecom. In the event that the Subscriber reaches the Credit Limit set out by Nepal Telecom, Subscriber will be required to pay an interim payment to bring the Service Dues to an amount lesser than the Credit Limit in order to prevent Service disruptions.

The Subscriber shall promptly settle Service Dues on or before the Due-Date as stipulated in the statements or bills presented by Nepal Telecom to the Subscriber and/or on demand by Nepal Telecom from the Subscriber.

The Billing Cycle for the Services shall be decided by Nepal Telecom from time to time and the statements or bills shall be sent to the Subscriber accordingly. It is incumbent on the Subscriber to enquire and settle any outstanding Service Dues in the case of non-receipt of the said statements or bills for any reason whatsoever.

The Subscriber shall pay a penalty charge of an additional Two Percent (2%) per month or such other rate/amount as may be decided by Nepal Telecom from time to time, for any Service Dues outstanding beyond the Due Date until the actual date of payment.
Nepal Telecom reserves the right to withdraw any applicable discount or loyalty benefit offered to the Subscriber for non-settlement of Service Dues by the Due Date.

Any queries regarding billing should be raised as follows: Post-Paid: within 30 days from the date of the bill; Pre-Paid: within 30 days of the Service consumption. Any queries made thereafter shall not be entertained.
Nepal Telecom reserves the right to recover any Service Dues from the Deposit(s) (as defined in Clause 4) under any other Account held by the Subscriber.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, Nepal Telecom may suspend or disconnect the Service partially or fully due to non-payment according to the applicable provisions of the GTC.
Upon accepting the application for Service and/or at any time after Nepal Telecom may request the Subscriber to make payment of a deposit/s of such an amount/value as decided by Nepal Telecom.

If the Subscriber fails to make payment to Nepal Telecom of such deposit/s and/or additional deposit/s Nepal Telecom may suspend or disconnect the Service partially or fully due to non-payment of such deposit/s and/or additional deposit/s.
On termination of the Service, Nepal Telecom shall deduct all arrears and Service Dues outstanding from the said deposit/s and the balance, if any, will be refunded to the Subscriber.
